results.definition: to hold fast or prevent from moving
catch in or as if in a trap
something (often something deceptively attractive) that catches you unawares
examples: the exam was full of trap questions

results.definition: a hazard on a golf course
place in a confining or embarrassing position
examples: He was trapped in a difficult situation

results.definition: the act of concealing yourself and lying in wait to attack by surprise
a device in which something (usually an animal) can be caught and penned
a device to hurl clay pigeons into the air for trapshooters
drain consisting of a U-shaped section of drainpipe that holds liquid and so prevents a return flow of sewer gas
hold or catch as if in a trap
examples: The gaps between the teeth trap food particles
